content.description: Start low at the base of the arete with a nice left hand hold and low right undercling. Head straight up, using poor left hand face holds and the arete for your right.
content.location: From the top of the Carver Classic walk up and right around the side of the Squirrel Boulder. Wrecker Anchor is on the boulder with the obvious arete jutting out into space.

content.description: Sit start with hands on lower crack. Climb up the blocky middle of the face.
content.location: Warmup Boulder. The farthest north boulder on the main trail.

content.description: Work your way up the flake system on the left.
content.location: Warmup Boulder. The farthest north boulder on the main trail.

content.description:
The 2011 Carver Bouldering Guide calls this "Perhaps the best problem at Carver." I'm sure that's debatable, but this is definitely a proud line.

 Start standing at the low point of the boulder with a left-hand pinch and a right-hand crimp. Hike your feet up and fire for the lip. I thought this would be the crux. I was wrong.

 After a powerful move using an undercling-flake thing (this might be the crux), finish with a series of long, powerful moves between evenly-spaced slopers on the lip/arete (this too might be the crux). Finish with a committing top-out at the boulder's apex (definitely the mental crux).

 The upper moves are the standard finish to a number of harder problems on this boulder. I'm sure they feel casual once you've dialed them in. I chose to onsight this rig while solo bouldering and found myself definitely wishing I had a spotter.
content.protection: Multiple pads over a rising, terraced, uneven landing that includes a stump.  Watch out for the rocks behind the landing zone. Potential for a bad fall if you blow it in the wrong spot.
content.location: On the Stump Boulder, just uphill from the Cedar Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious rail to the right near the upward sloping boulder.  Head left on the crimpy sidepulls and slopers to finish on the dirty slab.
content.protection: 5-6 pads to cover the landing and the surrounding boulders of the pit.
content.location: In the pit of boulders to the right of Optimus Prime.

content.description: Posting this on MP cause it's a great route that more people should hop on. Starts on a fairly obvious positive left hand hold and the base of the right arete. A multitude of different betas are possible. Original start holds are circled for convenience.
content.location: Behind and to the right of the Yosemite boulder (from facing Classic Face V1), there is a small pit. Universal Head is the boulder sitting between two others, forming a nice cave and overhanging face.

content.description: Sit-start on small rock next to the boulder with right hand on undercling then moves up and left to finish.
content.location: On the traffic boulder, just up the hill from Columbia boulders

content.description: Beautiful triangle boulder just below Angular Motion. Start sitting on two incuts, big move right to a pinch, awkward move left to a sloper, dyno to the top. This is my favorite problem in the world. Literally. If you plopped this boulder down in the middle of Yosemite, it would still be a mega classic. Do yourself a favor and get on this problem.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. If you flub the dyno, you might roll backwards into the brush.
content.location: From the obvious path in the back of the Inn parking lot, follow the path that goes right and uphill. Keep following the path uphill at any intersections you encounter. Just as you’re approaching the Education Boulder (uphill and on your left), you’ll see Triangle Face peeking out straight ahead and further uphill.

content.description: Climbs the center of the imposing Columbia Boulder. This is perhaps my favorite climb at Carver due to its interesting sequence through a series of ledges leading to a long reach to the top. I would not recommend biffing it up there, the fall would likely be pretty nasty.
content.location: To the Right of TIA on the Columbia Boulder, climb the center of the face using a variety of face holds and ledges.

content.description: Start on the "education" boulder, next to the stump boulders. On the south face, there are two low crimps. Make an awkward move right to a supposedly drilled pocket and up to the rail and top out. Pretty cool movement and a long problem for Carver.
content.protection: A couple pads would be nice.
content.location: On the big boulder just below Triangle Face.

content.description: Sit Start on a couple good edges. Stand up and head up and left towards a juggy topout. Utilize an obviously chalked pinch and figure out a good sequence. A bit reachy.
content.location: On the "Columbia" boulder. It is the obvious large boulder that you first see upon entering the main woods. Looks like Africa.

content.description: Standing start to Classic Overhang problem. Fun movement with a nice jug and throw to the top.
content.location: On the Trail Boulder, which is near the cliff face above the Triangle Boulder.

content.description: Direct finish to cedar project. Doesn't seem much harder. Cool Slopers.
content.location: Cedar

content.description: Start with left hand sloper Arete and right hand semi sharp crimp. Pull on and latch the crimp. From here use the jugs and top out.
content.location: Left of cedar project.

content.description:
Starts with an inverted sit start in the cave of Carver classic. Jam your feet into the crack above and transition from the invert up and through the crack. Sequence climbs crack direct.

 Please provide input on the grade - I've indicated V2+, but this was after refining the beta. This may change depending on community consensus. Onsight this could feel harder.
content.location: Directly to the left of Carver Classic, climbs the flaring offwidth crack formed by the two boulders.

content.description: Direct harder finish to naughty karate.
content.protection: A good amount of pads forsure

content.description: Mantle the short boulder....
content.protection: 3-4 pads for the bottom of the pit.
content.location: In the pit of boulders to the right of Optimus Prime.

content.description: Low start to Universal Head. Starts compressed with a low left hand on the juggy sidepull and a right hand on the flat face. Multitude of betas.Was originally put up as a V10 but consensus seems to average out at V9 nowadays. Climb it and decide for yourself!

Sit down start, with the left side pull and right crimp.  Reasonable bump with the right hand then straight to the top arete and mantle out.  Excellent warm up problem in the shadow of the imposing Yosemite Boulder!
content.protection: 2-3 crash pads AND a spotter.  If you miss the big move you could potentially fall backwards onto the point of another, smaller boulder.
content.location: From the parking lot, enter the main forest behind the fenced area built out for the restaurant's large garbage containers.  Follow the trail to the right and after a very short incline, you will see the large Yosemite Boulder (approx. 15-20 feet tall).  Right Heel Man is on the smaller boulder on the right hand side of Yosemite.

content.description: Standing start. Use good edges to make your way up the face of the Red Ant boulder.
Start as for “East Side intro” but finish up red Ant instead
content.location: Red Ant Boulder

content.description: Same start as Maintenance Men. Move up to arete and then traverse right around the prow to mantle/ top out
content.location: Dig out boulder

content.description: Start standing on right arête; traverse left using the face holds and avoiding the spine
content.location: On the Traffic Boulder just up the hill from the Columbia Boulders

content.description:
Sit start on the obvious rail and work right on the jugs near the lip.  Get to the top of the sloping right arete, stand up onto the slab and finish a few more easy moves. 

  Shares the same start as Virgin Connie Swail.
content.protection: 5-6 pads to cover the pit of boulders and the sloping boulder underneath the first few moves.
content.location: In the pit just to the right of Optimus Prime.

content.description: Campus from small edges to bigger edges and ledges. Classic!!
content.location: On the North side of the Yosemite boulder, right along the approach to the Dragenet boulder.  You'll also pass right above the Heel boulder.

content.description: This problem didn't make it in the original guidebook, but was later mentioned in a blogpost as problem #3a. That description had the SDS on the crimps in the middle, but we've enjoyed traversing over from the flake holds (as pictured), and climbing up the slab. The arete is off for this problem.
content.location: Unnamed boulder SE of Yosemite Boulder and directly E of Animal Magnetism boulder.

content.description: Start on the best hold in the middle of the face and head up. Powerful moves on delicate feet. Fun one.
content.location: On the Birthday Boulder. To the right of All Smiles. On the face.

content.description: Start on two obvious holds, traverse left and angle up and right into the V3 Arete.
content.protection: Definitely bring some pads. Spotters aren't necessary if you have enough pads.
content.location: Just past cedar project

content.description: Sit down start moving straight up to top out
content.location: Dig out boulder

content.description: Sit down start, move along arete to pinnacle
content.location: Small boulder climbers right of Columbia boulder

content.description: The rail of positive holds heading right, but mantle half way to the top.  Classic!
content.protection: About 3 pads.  You'll want one/two to cover the downed tree right off the landing and one to cover the slope down to hill.
content.location: Around the corner from Trask (to the left if you are facing it) and across from Carver Classic.  Obvious juggy rails work up and to the right.  At this point you start standing on the downed tree.

content.description:
Start matched in the sharp pod jug on the left side of the short overhang. You'll know it when you see it.  

  Figure your way to the right, and finish as for Cause of Death using the flake holds directly next to the arete. The big flake jug way off right on the slab is off, fyi.
content.location: Same boulder as Cause of Death, starts on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: SDS from the lowest point of the boulder. Start on positive side pull climbing left to the rails. Pop up to the slab and trust the feet to the top. Also the start for Higher Education.
content.location: Education Boulder just below Triangle Face

content.description: SDS with left hand on arete, right hand down on the face on a sidepull/undercling thing with a right heel hook directly under the hand and go to the crimper flake in the middle of the face. from there match and throw to the lip up and right to finish up on barfly betty
content.protection: a pad under you and a pad vertical against the boulder at your back with a spotter
content.location: this "area" is called wrecking anchor and is just up and right of carver classic. this line basically starts the v8 wrecking anchor and finishes the v3 barfly betty

content.description:
Start sitting in the overhang with a left hand sidepull and right hand edge. Figure out how to get out of the hole and up to the lip. Heck, the lip isn't even that far away, how hard could it be?  

  Hard.
content.location:
On the parking lot side of the Columbia boulder there is the Hoik boulder leaning against it, forming a nice little cave. Hoik is visible in the short overhang as you walk by.  

  There is a fairly obvious low brick jug right next to the trail. This is the start to Super Cool, the low start to Hoik. Hoik starts just up and right of this brick hold.

content.description: Climb the Intruder problem up to the prow. Round the corner and connect with the Education problem to finish on the face. Awesome combo of routes with fun compression in the middle!
content.protection: 3 pads or a couple and a spotter
content.location: Education boulder

content.description: Sit start and face climb on the edges and side pulls above the large rocks in the landing, finishing on the juggy rails to the left.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Jugs v0.

content.description: Start on the lowest part of the arete, hand traverse along the arete on obvious big holds to the top out.  Easy but fun!
content.location: "Traffic" bolder's obvious long arete.  Uphill and left from Columbia bolder.

content.description: SDS on the two crimps, work straight up on better holds and mantle to the top.  Start is the most difficult move.
content.location: Left side of "Traffic" boulder, which is uphill and lookers left from the Columbia bolder.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious rail on the boulder to the left of Carver Classic. Go up and left on the nice jugs to top out.
content.protection: No more than 1 pad and no spotter necessary.
content.location: Boulder left of Carver Classic. Right next to the large Columbia boulder right at the entrance next to the parking lot and the Owl boulder.

content.description: Start Matched on the knobbly waist high lip hold. Climb left a few moves and then struggle your way to the good flake jug straight above the start hold.
content.location: Same start as Cause of Death.

content.description:
Start matched on the slopey ledge on the blunt left corner of the large face just uphill from Carver Classic. Traverse left and then up to a large blocky hold. Top out.  

  Uses a nice mix of slopes and crimps. Climbs really well!
content.location: Start on the slopey ledge on the left side of the face just uphill from Carver Classic.

content.description: Same start as Virgin Connie Swail (SDS on rail), but climb up and to the right above the slanted rock to finish on the right hand arete.
content.protection: 5-6 pads to cover the landing and the surrounding boulders of the pit.
content.location: In the pit of boulders to the right of Optimus Prime.

content.description: Start standing, left hand undercling flake, right hand sloping edge. Move up to the arete and top out at the center. Same arete finish as Higher Education.
content.location: Education Boulder below Triangle Face

content.description: Start on rail, do an insanely hard move to the obvious crimp and traverse left. Really?!

The hardest line on the boulder, the Columbian combines the cruxes of Jaws of Death and Bloody Apron. Start as for Jaws, matched in the sharp pod jug, pounce out to the arete and then finish straight up using the poor arete holds and whatever left hand hold that strikes your fancy.
content.location: On the Cause of Death boulder, start as for Jaws of Death.

content.description: Originally in the guidebook as a V2, felt more like a moderate V1 to us. Starts on left edge and right undercling. The line we found seemed to go up and left, but perhaps there was another harder line that went right. Top out is a little cruxy and landing area is pretty uneven, so I'd recommend scoping it out up there before you head up.
content.protection: Two pads: one for the start and one for the boulder you traverse left over.
content.location: Pretty much a straight shot back from the dumpsters on the backside of the "Animal Magnetism" boulder. If you circle around the left side of the Yosemite boulder (with Classic Face and the Twilight sign on the front) and look up the hill and left, that is Animal Magnetism.

content.description: The boulder just below the cliff at the top of the trail.  Sit start the overhanging face and mantle the top. Smaller holds down low lead to good holds higher up and an exciting final move.
content.location: If you walk straight up towards the cliff you can't miss this boulder.  It is directly above the Triangle Boulder and directly below Angular Motion.

content.description: V1 start from the level ground, maybe V0 if you start high on the sloped boulder. Reachy moves from positive jug to positive jug with big feet. Mantle top out with decent hands.
content.protection: Awkward landing on a 45 degree slope; would need 2-3 pads to cover a tumble.
content.location: Yosemite Boulder. Obvious middle line on the NE face.

content.description: Move up the stab on good holds avoiding any moss or dirt
content.location: The right side of the Cedar Boulder in the Stump Boulders area

content.description: Sit start on jug, do Savage moves while trying not too dab.
content.location: The suspended boulder seen from the parking area.

content.description: Sit start on jug as for cedar project/southpaw but climb up past the glued on crimps to the top
SDS on the Cedar Slab problem then move left onto the arête holds and top out on the corner.
content.location: Located on the Cedar Boulder, in the Stump Boulders section below the Stump boulder.

content.description:
Start matched on a knobbly waist high hold on the lip. Move left and up until you can reach the good flake directly next to the arete. Finish straight up.  

  Do not use the enticing flake jug straight above the start hold, as this decreases the difficulty substantially (and is another climb!).
content.location: From the large Columbia boulder, follow the trail to the left (looking uphill), for about 30-40 feet. The trail curves around a ramping boulder and just uphill from that is the Cause of Death Boulder.

content.description: Another Carver Low Ball! Start inside the obvious cave on a chalked jug and an edge on the lip of the cave. Heals will be necessary to pull of the ground. Pull up to the lip and do a heinously awkward top-out. Body-smears optional. Top out at whopping 6 feet.
content.protection: One pad and someone to spot your head.
content.location: In obvious low cave about 50 feet from the entrance to the main woods. Right down the hill from the "Angry Squirrel" boulder and right next to the "Columbia" boulder.

content.description: Guidebook doesn't specify the SDS, but it makes it much more fun, if stiff, for a V2. Stand start in the dish seems like V0.
content.location: On Button Hole boulder, opposite Cedar Arete. Most easily accessed on trail from left of the dumpsters.

content.description:
Start matched on the waist high knobbly lip sloper, as for Cause of Death. Climb the beginning of Cause of Death, but transition to the left. Use the nasty slopey arete and whatever left hand holds you fancy to top out.  

  Climbs well, but man this is hard.
content.location: Same start as Cause of Death.

content.description: Start on the juggy flake on the right side of the overhang. Bump up to the lip and pull yourselves up on side pulls. Short and sweet!
content.location: Right side of Wrecker Anchor boulder! Just above the carver classic

content.description:
An extension to Flying Squirrel, this climb traverses the entirety of the Squirrel Boulder.  

  Start matched on the jug undercling on the far right of the wall, traverse left into Flying Squirrel with difficulty, using whichever crimps you prefer.
content.location: On the same boulder as Flying Squirrel, just uphill from Carver Classic.

content.description: The Main Forest comprises everything between the parking lot and the cliffs above.
